page.title: 08CHATFIELDS TIMBER YARD
page.content: Over 200 years after its beginning, Chatfields of Cooksbridge is still owned by the same family and{employs {25 people.}12 years ago the whole yard was destroyed by a tremendous fire, so hot that the curtains in the houses opposite caught alight. Fire engines came from Kent and Surrey. Chatfields timber comes from North and South America, USSR and Scandanavia. It is{mostly soft wood,}as hard woods are too expensive, and comes in 10-12m lengths. Chatfields many circular and band saws are sharpened twice a week.After being treated, wood is made into skirting boards,window and door frames and other pieces of carpentry. Apart from wood{Chatfields sells other {building materials}like concrete and bricks. Chatfields deliver within a hundred mile radius,mostly to builders but will also sell to the public.
